name: Google Sheets MCP - AI-Powered Spreadsheet Management

nodes.name: MCP Server Trigger
nodes.notes:
üöÄ MCP TRIGGER

This is the entry point for AI interactions with Google Sheets. The MCP (Model Context Protocol) trigger allows AI models to call any of the connected Google Sheets tools based on user requests.

Key Features:
‚Ä¢ Enables natural language spreadsheet commands
‚Ä¢ Routes AI requests to appropriate Sheets operations
‚Ä¢ Provides context-aware data management
‚Ä¢ Supports complex multi-step data workflows
‚Ä¢ Handles dynamic sheet and document selection

nodes.name: Google Sheets - Read Data
nodes.notes:
üìä READ SPREADSHEET DATA

Retrieve and analyze data from Google Sheets. Perfect for AI to read, process, and extract insights from spreadsheet content.

Use Cases:
‚Ä¢ "Read data from the Sales sheet"
‚Ä¢ "Get all entries from A1:E100"
‚Ä¢ "Show me the data in the Budget spreadsheet"
‚Ä¢ "Extract customer information from the CRM sheet"

AI Parameters:
‚Ä¢ Document_ID: Target spreadsheet ID
‚Ä¢ Sheet_Name: Specific sheet tab name
‚Ä¢ Range: Cell range to read (optional)

nodes.name: Google Sheets - Clear Data
nodes.notes:
üóëÔ∏è CLEAR SPREADSHEET DATA

Remove data from specific ranges or entire sheets. Useful for resetting data, clearing temporary calculations, or preparing sheets for new data.

Use Cases:
‚Ä¢ "Clear all data from the temp sheet"
‚Ä¢ "Remove entries from A1:E100"
‚Ä¢ "Clean up the old data in column C"
‚Ä¢ "Reset the calculation area"

AI Parameters:
‚Ä¢ Document_ID: Target spreadsheet ID
‚Ä¢ Sheet_Name: Sheet to clear data from
‚Ä¢ Range: Specific range to clear

‚ö†Ô∏è Use with caution - data will be permanently removed!

nodes.name: Google Sheets - Add Data
nodes.notes:
‚ûï ADD NEW DATA

Append new rows of data to existing sheets. Perfect for adding records, logging events, or inserting new entries without affecting existing data.

Use Cases:
‚Ä¢ "Add a new customer to the CRM sheet"
‚Ä¢ "Log today's sales data"
‚Ä¢ "Insert a new project entry"
‚Ä¢ "Record the meeting notes"

AI Parameters:
‚Ä¢ Document_ID: Target spreadsheet ID
‚Ä¢ Sheet_Name: Sheet to add data to
‚Ä¢ Data_To_Add: Array/object of new data

Features:
‚Ä¢ Automatically finds next empty row
‚Ä¢ Preserves existing data
‚Ä¢ Supports multiple columns

nodes.name: Google Sheets - Create Sheet
nodes.notes:
üìã CREATE NEW SHEET

Create new worksheet tabs within existing spreadsheets. Great for organizing data into categories or creating project-specific sheets.

Use Cases:
‚Ä¢ "Create a new sheet called 'Q4 Sales'"
‚Ä¢ "Add a Project Timeline sheet"
‚Ä¢ "Make a new Budget 2024 tab"
‚Ä¢ "Create a sheet for customer feedback"

AI Parameters:
‚Ä¢ Document_ID: Target spreadsheet ID
‚Ä¢ New_Sheet_Name: Name for the new sheet
‚Ä¢ Header_Row: Optional column headers

Best Practices:
‚Ä¢ Use descriptive sheet names
‚Ä¢ Include header rows for data structure
‚Ä¢ Consider sheet organization strategy

nodes.name: Google Sheets - Update Data
nodes.notes:
‚úèÔ∏è UPDATE EXISTING DATA

Modify specific cells or ranges with new values. Perfect for updating records, correcting data, or maintaining current information.

Use Cases:
‚Ä¢ "Update the status in cell C5 to 'Complete'"
‚Ä¢ "Change the price in the product list"
‚Ä¢ "Modify the project deadline"
‚Ä¢ "Update customer contact information"

AI Parameters:
‚Ä¢ Document_ID: Target spreadsheet ID
‚Ä¢ Sheet_Name: Sheet containing data to update
‚Ä¢ Range: Specific cells to update (e.g., A1:B2)
‚Ä¢ New_Values: Array of new values

Tip: Use precise ranges to avoid overwriting unintended data

parameters.content:
## üéØ WORKFLOW OVERVIEW

**Google Sheets MCP - AI-Powered Spreadsheet Management**

This workflow provides a complete toolkit for intelligent spreadsheet management through AI interactions using the Model Context Protocol (MCP).

**Core Capabilities:**
‚Ä¢ üìä Read and analyze spreadsheet data
‚Ä¢ ‚ûï Add new records and entries
‚Ä¢ ‚úèÔ∏è Update existing information
‚Ä¢ üóëÔ∏è Clear data and reset ranges
‚Ä¢ üìã Create new worksheet tabs
‚Ä¢ ü§ñ Natural language commands

**Getting Started:**
1. Ensure Google Sheets OAuth2 is configured
2. Test each tool individually
3. Use natural language with your AI
4. Monitor workflow execution logs
5. Start with simple read operations

## üöÄ Google Sheets MCP - AI-Powered Spreadsheet Management
**What it does:**
This is the entry point for AI interactions with Google Sheets. The MCP trigger enables natural language spreadsheet commands.

**Key Features:**
‚Ä¢ Enables conversational data management
‚Ä¢ Routes AI requests to appropriate operations
‚Ä¢ Supports dynamic sheet selection
‚Ä¢ Handles complex multi-step workflows
‚Ä¢ Provides context-aware responses

**Example Commands:**
"Read data from the Sales sheet"
"Add a new customer record"
"Update the project status"
"Create a new budget sheet"

## üìä READ DATA

**Purpose:**
Retrieve and analyze data from Google Sheets for AI processing and insights.

**Use Cases:**
‚Ä¢ "Show me all customer data"
‚Ä¢ "Read the sales figures from Q3"
‚Ä¢ "Get project status from column D"
‚Ä¢ "Extract budget information"

**AI Parameters:**
‚Ä¢ **Document_ID:** Spreadsheet identifier
‚Ä¢ **Sheet_Name:** Target worksheet tab
‚Ä¢ **Range:** Cell range (optional)

**Returns:** Raw data for AI analysis

## üóëÔ∏è CLEAR DATA

**Purpose:**
Remove data from specific ranges or entire sheets safely and efficiently.

**Use Cases:**
‚Ä¢ "Clear the temporary calculations"
‚Ä¢ "Remove old data from column C"
‚Ä¢ "Reset the input area"
‚Ä¢ "Clean up test entries"

**AI Parameters:**
‚Ä¢ **Document_ID:** Target spreadsheet
‚Ä¢ **Sheet_Name:** Sheet to clear
‚Ä¢ **Range:** Specific area to clear

**‚ö†Ô∏è Warning:** Data removal is permanent

## ‚ûï ADD DATA

**Purpose:**
Append new records to existing sheets without affecting current data.

**Use Cases:**
‚Ä¢ "Add new customer: John Doe, email@example.com"
‚Ä¢ "Log today's sales: $1,500"
‚Ä¢ "Insert project milestone"
‚Ä¢ "Record meeting attendance"

**AI Parameters:**
‚Ä¢ **Document_ID:** Target spreadsheet
‚Ä¢ **Sheet_Name:** Destination sheet
‚Ä¢ **Data_To_Add:** New row data

**Feature:** Auto-finds next empty row

## üìã CREATE SHEET

**Purpose:**
Create new worksheet tabs for better data organization and project management.

**Use Cases:**
‚Ä¢ "Create 'Q4 Budget' sheet"
‚Ä¢ "Add new project tracking tab"
‚Ä¢ "Make customer feedback sheet"
‚Ä¢ "Create monthly report tab"

**AI Parameters:**
‚Ä¢ **Document_ID:** Target spreadsheet
‚Ä¢ **New_Sheet_Name:** Tab name
‚Ä¢ **Header_Row:** Column headers

**Tip:** Use descriptive names

## ‚úèÔ∏è UPDATE DATA

**Purpose:**
Modify specific cells with new values while preserving surrounding data.

**Use Cases:**
‚Ä¢ "Update status in C5 to 'Complete'"
‚Ä¢ "Change price in product list"
‚Ä¢ "Modify project deadline"
‚Ä¢ "Update contact information"

**AI Parameters:**
‚Ä¢ **Document_ID:** Target spreadsheet
‚Ä¢ **Sheet_Name:** Source sheet
‚Ä¢ **Range:** Cells to update (e.g., A1:B2)
‚Ä¢ **New_Values:** Replacement data

**Tip:** Use precise cell references

nodes.name: Google Sheets - Delete Sheet
nodes.notes:
üóëÔ∏è DELETE SHEET

Remove entire worksheet tabs when they're no longer needed. Use with caution as this permanently removes all data in the sheet.

Use Cases:
‚Ä¢ "Delete the old temp sheet"
‚Ä¢ "Remove the expired project tab"
‚Ä¢ "Clean up test worksheets"
‚Ä¢ "Delete duplicate sheets"

AI Parameters:
‚Ä¢ Document_ID: Target spreadsheet ID
‚Ä¢ Sheet_Name: Sheet tab to delete

‚ö†Ô∏è PERMANENT ACTION - Cannot be undone!
Always backup important data first.

parameters.content:
## üóëÔ∏è DELETE SHEET

**Purpose:**
Permanently remove entire worksheet tabs and all their contained data.

**Use Cases:**
‚Ä¢ "Delete the old testing sheet"
‚Ä¢ "Remove expired project tabs"
‚Ä¢ "Clean up temporary worksheets"
‚Ä¢ "Delete duplicate or unused sheets"

**AI Parameters:**
‚Ä¢ **Document_ID:** Target spreadsheet
‚Ä¢ **Sheet_Name:** Tab to remove

**‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL WARNING:**
This permanently deletes ALL data in the sheet.
Operation cannot be undone!
Always backup important data first.
